poem:
**Echoes of Silence**

In the marrow of truth,  
ghosts whisper justice,  
a fragile ledger  
etched in invisible ink.  
Bodies tremble,  
earth-shaking fears  
etched in haunted air.  
In the loom of night,  
their stories spin,  
unraveled threads  
of forgotten voices,  
awaiting the light,  
a reckoning,  
a ticking heart  
that demands to beat.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. It was what I can only describe as a kind of corporeal attack, an existential clutch followed by days of such powerful anxiety my body was taken in bouts of uncontrollable shaking. A sense of not mattering, a virulent dread and dissolving". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
